page.title: 16MARK YEO
page.content: LOOKING AT THE COURSE OF THE MARK YEO ON THE ORDNANCE SURVEY MAP,THE FIRST THOUGH IS THAT THIS NOW SMALL RIVER IS VERY STRAIGHT.IT MUST MAN MADE,OR AT LEAST HAVE BEEN STRAIGHTENED Y MAN.TO THE NORTH OF THE BLOCK,IT OINS THE'OLD'RIVER AXE THEN TO THE RIVER AXE AND TO THE BRISTOL CHANNEL AT UPHILL. TODAY IT IS NO MORE THAN A WIDE,STRAIGHT DITCH,FULL OF WATER WITH ACCESS ALONG ITS BANK FOR CATTLE TO DRINK. IT WAS NOT ALWAYS SO.IN THE DARK AGES WHEN THE ABBOTT OF GLASTONBURY WAS AT POWER IN THE LAND,GOODS FOR THE ABBEY WERE BROUGHT TO THE PORT OF UPHILL AND ONWARDS,BY SMALL BOATS,TO THE MARK YEO AND THEN BY WAY OF THE RIVER BRUE TO GLASTONBURY. ONCE AN IMPORTANT WATERWAY,TODAY PART OF OUR MOORLAND DRAINAGE SYSTEM.
